answers.answer: Yes it can, and you.  it can cause pre eclampsia and make the baby come premature.  Is there any way you can explain this to the rest of the household?

Stress is not good for you or the baby.  It can raise you bp or cause contractions but it doesn't cause preeclampsia- whose cause is unknown. I too am beyond stressed and cannot take my anti-anxiety meds bc of the pregnancy. Take some deep cleansing breaths and try to relax. Visualise your healthy baby. I am currently on bed rest bc of the consequences of my stress
If that doesn't work you could talk to a professional once a week.
Stress also decreases blood flow to your uterus possibly triggering premature labor or producing a low birth weight.

I have tried to tell them that im stressed, but it never works. She keeps wanting to set up my babies crib in the two year olds room and i keep saying I don't want that. Who would? It just won't work. Idk I work full time and can't ever sleep cause they are just so loud, along with there three little dogs that wake me up. I'm only getting about 4 hours of sleep a day if even..
Buy some earplugs? I use them because even little sounds wake me up. They help me block out the distracting noise and get some sleep.

question: I'm 27 weeks and have always been stressed to the max since I found out I was pregnant. Had to leave my home because roommates smoked, but now living with boyfriends mother and her 2 year old granddaughter and omg I never can sleep or realax cause of them. Just how bad is stress when pregnant? I've been to the er three times from it but they just said to relax..but i cant. Can stress harm the baby??
title: Just how bad is stress?
